text.p: These are the leading stories in the Kenyan press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Bishop David Gitari is elected the new Archbishop of the Church of the Province of Kenya (Anglican church).

- Democratic Party Chairman Mwai Kibaki, accuses the government of illegally having two accounts at the Central Bank of Kenya. He says it uses them as conduits for money to "politically correct" commercial banks and for bankrolling the ruling party's campaigns.
- The contractors of the Kenya's third international Airport in Eldoret town will carry out a test flight in the next few days to calibrate its equipment.
- The government announces historic amendments to the Central Bank Act which will among other things, limit government borrowing.
- Kenya can now breed Alpine dairy goats. This has been made possible through crossbreeding between German Alpine bucks and Kenyan goats.
- The German government agrees to issue former leader of the unregistered Islamic Party of Kenya Sheikh Khalid Balala, with travelling documents to facilitate his return to Kenya.
